notes:
### Hover over the item icons below (not hyperlinks) to read additional information!

Always buy  [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) and  [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da) 
Extra HP allows you to earn more money

In the first two rounds, your job is to simply survive and deal damage, getting assists and eliminations for participating in the fight. If you take a lot of risks to get solo kills without having extra hp and die, you will not only spend more time running from the respawn to the action (and therefore earn less), you will also give money to your opponents.

round_upgrades.notes: Shields on top of armor will act as armor, which will help you a lot against other Soldiers, as well as Reaper, Mei, Zarya, D.Va, and Queen.

This item will increase bullet damage from 19 to 19.95. In the realities of Stadium, this is completely unnoticeable when playing as Soldier, because all enemies have more HP than in a normal game, and no breakpoints are formed at such small numbers.

Without any items, you can deal 251 damage with a direct hit from a rocket and 5 bullets. With +5% weapon power and +10% ability power items, you can kill a 250 HP target with a direct hit from a rocket and 4 bullets. Is -1 bullet worth 25 of your armor?

notes:
If you have a lot of money, you can get [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) for an extra 10% ability power. 

Also note that I'm not selling survival items because you won't have enough rocket damage until round 3 for the extra 10% ability power to matter.

But if you play with pocket Mercy, you can take a risk if you are just a little short of another +10% AP item. This will add 6 to 13 damage to your rockets under the blue beam, depending on whether you hit direct or somewhere nearby. Whether it is worth it or not - decide for yourself.

The third option is if you get a map with good high grounds, then you can take  [Bomb Diffusal Boots](item_c555901e-1b69-4040-8420-ee81cbaf6d90) because a strong position will be better than a small bonus to damage or survival.

round_upgrades.notes: Shields on top of armor will act as armor, which will help you a lot against other Soldiers, as well as Reaper, Mei, Zarya, D.Va, and Queen.
A small boost to survivability will be more important than weapon power percentages or attack speed

If you have 350 HP, of which 150 are shields and 25 armor, that is, in fact, 175 armor, then you will die only because of your mistakes. This option is good when the team is strong and you can simply help with your damage and earn money for participation. I would call this the greediest and safest option.

It's very rare when I play with a pocket Mercy that I'll be able to save up enough for two +10% AP blue items, one +20% item, and one +10% green item by round 2. But when that happens, I almost always take them at the expense of survivability so I can continue snowballing. Keep in mind that Mercy often provides more value to the team when she revives someone and activates Valkyrie, so your goal is simply to not die in bad spots and maximize your damage advantage.

notes:
The idea behind  [Mark of the Kitsune](item_09a53e39-25aa-4f66-ba51-bedbc543a1eb) is that you can use Biotic Field or Helix Rockets early, before a fight, and get bonus damage to your next bullet hit on an enemy. This bonus will not expire over time if you do not shoot anyone and it scales with ability power. 

So with the first 2-3 bullets you can deal damage like with 5-6. Right after the first shots you fire Helix, and the bonus from Mark of the Kitsune activates again for the next hit if you need to finish off a target. That's why you don't need weapon damage or attack speed, just ability power.

This item, as well as the second power for Helix Rockets, create a turning point: now your build is online and you don't need survival or weapon damage because you will kill others with ability damage faster than they will kill you.. You should only look for an opportunity for an off-angle and combo, and run to safety immediately after you finish it. Repeat every 6 seconds.

What combos am I talking about? You'll find out from the description for the next round and the notes on the items.

You can play as a flanker, or you can spam combos on the main while behind the tank: it all depends on how comfortable you are finding your opportunities and what map it is.

#### **Round 4 is extremely important for this build because you can get a serious power spike, while many other builds will only get it on the next round.**
In this round, everything depends on how much money you were able to farm, so those who were patient in the first two rounds will get the reward.

#### The ideal option: 
just buy [Champion's Kit](item_8682f8c7-8811-439b-8d50-fa81cd43ddce) and get 80% AP total. In this case, a combo of 5 shots (with a charged MotK) and rockets under the feet will deal up to 374 damage. Details in the description of the epic item (hover over the item in the window below, not the hyperlink).

#### Situational option:

Buy these instead of one epic item:  [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) ,  [Energized Bracers](item_f83a1d9e-91f8-4d2c-bd62-c673b8d9fd2e) ,  [Biolight Overflow](item_1220eaec-f913-4de2-816c-0dc070b285d0). You will have good unconditional damage with rockets and from  [Mark of the Kitsune](item_09a53e39-25aa-4f66-ba51-bedbc543a1eb) at 65% AP, and your ult will give you and your teammates in a radius of 25 meters 50 overhealth for 3s when activated. You will also have 10% lifesteal from rocket damage. You can call it a bet on one key moment when you will help the team survive and win. Additional info in the note to Biolight below.

#### When you're short on money, there are other options:

**26000**
If your targets have a lot of HP (400 or more), you can buy [Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429) 
5-shot + Helix deals 354 damage; 3-shot + Helix + 3 shots deals 408 damage. Details in the note to the Three-tap.

**25250**
Buy [Custom Stock](item_17d633af-8bcc-4893-b865-be0a7bc66fe2) and [Energized Bracers](item_f83a1d9e-91f8-4d2c-bd62-c673b8d9fd2e)
5 shots + Helix under the feet does 351 damage. 3 shots + Helix + 3 shots = 411 damage.

**22500**
Life is hard for the poor, isn't it? Buy [Energized Bracers](item_f83a1d9e-91f8-4d2c-bd62-c673b8d9fd2e) and [Shady Spectacles](item_ef9bb72f-a56c-4fb6-a552-5abce0b943d7)
The idea is that +5% WP from Custom Stock won't change anything, but an additional 20% lifesteal from Helix's high damage can save your life.

round_upgrades.notes: Rockets under the feet = 234 damage, Mark of the Kitsune deals 64. Combo of 5 hits and rockets: 64 + 19 * 4 + 234 = 374 damage. If you add just one more hit after the rockets (it will be charged again), then this is already 438 damage. Combo of 3 hits + Rockets + 3 hits will deal the same amount. A direct hit from a rocket will deal 306 damage. You can sell the green item if you're just a little short, and then you'll have 70% AP, meaning the previous combo will deal 384 damage.

notes:
In round 5, all meta builds will get another big power spike. Usually, you just want to get the most ability power for your money, but sometimes it makes sense to think about survival. Judge based on the HP of your opponents: if they go for damage and neglect survival, then you can do the opposite, because you will definitely have enough damage to kill them faster. And vice versa.

Besides the obvious items that give armor or shields, I would highlight Iron Lung, because it fits your playstyle perfectly and works not only as an overhealth, but also as a continuous heal while you are sprinting, which is very helpful for survival. You can assume that your maximum HP will not just be +25%, but +35% or even more if someone is chasing you.

As for the choice of the third Power, everything is obvious: to increase your survivability, as well as to always have the ability to press the combo "Biotic Field - shot - Helix - shot", you take [Track and Field](item_b3750fe4-e416-42b6-ad9e-fe92c7dcffc5)

This round, you should have enough money to start optimizing your slot usage and buying missing items if you didn't have enough money before.

Since the enemy team is now pretty high on HP, [Three-tap Tommygun](item_39c5d2a4-1db0-444f-86d9-2a1e9a331429) will be a priority - replace any cheap item with this. This is especially true against mobile, fast, flying heroes, and on maps where you have to storm high ground - in all these cases, you will often miss with rockets.

Maximizing AP is a priority, because killing with rockets is much more reliable than finishing off targets with rifle shots. This may require you to close the distance to less than 10 meters to better hit with rockets and have a chance at direct hits, so it's worth thinking about survival as well.

That's why, if you have some extra money after buying all the main items, you can sacrifice a small amount of AP to buy either  [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) or  [Iron Lung](item_22867dc9-50a1-4523-a77a-2fd67b487b51) 
But only if your targets don't have a lot of HP! Both items affect your survivability differently and reduce downtime after taking damage, and both items will be in the final version of the build.

And vice versa, if your opponents have a lot of HP, buy [Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b) 

#### What you shouldn't buy:
[Cybervenom](item_210a8582-91ec-4cf3-968a-a443f3a0c505)
only 2s of debuff after damage from Rockets is not enough, and if the target gets a lot of healing, it won't help you anyway. It's better to deal more damage at once by increasing AP.
[Liquid Nitrogen](item_a8d99526-05a3-4405-babb-b025479b1b98)
you are not a support, and your rockets are needed to guarantee kills, not to put debuffs on tanks
[Catalytic Crystal](item_3e3f4f77-cdf8-4dda-a5b0-2fb9390aefc4)
your ult is pretty weak, especially in the late game
[Vanadium Injection](item_57953fbc-11ff-4e92-9928-fc59b7be668f)
this item will not work for half of the round, and even when it does, only AP and HP are important to you. In addition, even if your ult is weak, it makes sense to use it at the right moment or against Mercy, Juno or Lucio, because they are the hardest for you to kill.
[Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b)
your targets have less than 30% HP only after the rockets explode, and therefore increasing the damage from your shots will not change much. This item is simply not worth the money in this build.

#### This is your final form!
The fourth Power can be whatever you like.

By default, I took two survival items into the build at once:  [Iron Lung](item_22867dc9-50a1-4523-a77a-2fd67b487b51)  and  [Lumerico Fusion Drive](item_3da81000-333c-460a-a1a2-09441bfda9c8) 

You can replace one of them with something from the list below:

[Superflexor](item_580b77b4-0d63-469b-99a8-5372c55dfc1b) adds HP and weapon damage, but the main thing is that it 
[El-sa'ka Supressor](item_b4298dd9-9b93-461f-a2e0-843402667100) with 30 rounds in the magazine, it is not difficult for the Soldier to occasionally hit the tank in the head and help the team with a debuff if at this time he cannot find a target for himself. And if you have excellent aim, then this will also help in duels, especially against Moira, Cassidy and Reaper.
[Salvaged Slugs](item_019d6c60-36eb-42ec-8d6e-5bbb44a0db61) in theory, can help pop Zarya's bubbles faster and finish her off with direct rockets; not sure, needs more testing
[Ironclad Exhaust Ports](item_2d085fa5-ace6-4fab-9323-b7a06268bcd0) cheap burst heal after rockets, because with Double Helix you get two uses of the ability in a row and +50hp. Very helpful in duels.

[Endgame Equalizer](item_a2143111-8fa0-4e3b-bbcf-12ed54587234)  is experimental option! 
The idea is this: immediately after using Helix, you press the ult and after 1.2 seconds you have Helix again. In this case, it makes sense to take either  [Biolight Overflow](item_1220eaec-f913-4de2-816c-0dc070b285d0) or  [Iridescent Iris](item_b7fb28ef-ce82-416b-8693-01c274f8df4e) along with this item. But keep in mind that this is an all-in option that should allow you to quickly kill 2-3 enemy heroes once per round. Very rarely will overtimes drag out the game so much that you can use two visors.

So the last thing I want to advise is not to forget about the situational item  [Bomb Diffusal Boots](item_c555901e-1b69-4040-8420-ee81cbaf6d90) during the game. The item can be useful at any stage of the game, depending on the map or the composition of the enemy team. Plus, you'll stop dying from your own rockets exploding, isn't that a wonderful item?

Good luck in your games, because you will definitely need luck to get more direct hits with your rockets!

round_upgrades.notes: gives the most AP per slot of the remaining options (provided that 5 stacks are activated, of course)
